meanings.definition: A speech defect in which sibilants are imperfectly pronounced
meanings.sent1: Her lisps made it hard to understand her when she spoke.
meanings.sent2: The child's lisps were noticeable when he tried to say 'sister'.
meanings.sent3: The lisps in his speech gave his words a unique twist.
meanings.sent4: His lisps added a charming quirk to his pronunciation.
meanings.sent5: The lisps in her speech stood out, making her memorable to everyone.

meanings.sent3: The comedian lisps intentionally to make people laugh.
meanings.sent4: His lisp lisps louder when he's nervous.
meanings.sent5: The child lisps softly, trying to pronounce the tricky words.
